title: Automatic convergence for Siegel modular forms
abstract:
Bruinier and Raum, building on work of Ibukiyama-Poor-Yuen, have studied a
notion of ``formal Siegel modular forms". These objects are formal sums that
have the symmetry properties of the Fourier expansion of a holomorphic Siegel
modular form. These authors proved that formal Siegel modular forms necessarily
converge absolutely on the Siegel half-space, and thus are the Fourier
expansion of an honest Siegel modular form. The purpose of this note is to give
a new proof of the cuspidal case of this ``automatic convergence" theorem of
Bruinier-Raum. We use the same basic ideas in a separate paper to prove an
automatic convergence theorem for cuspidal quaternionic modular forms on
exceptional groups.
